description: Create a new time on the cluster
name: create_timer
title: Create a new timer

Parameter.description: the time in milliseconds from now the timer should execute. This must be in the range: 0 < timeout < 2^31 - 1.
a data payload to include with the timer when it executes
The delivery transport to use when executing the timer
The method of delivery the tranport should use
A full uri the transport should send data to

Response Headers.description: URI of the created timer which can be used to modify or cancel the timer
An err message if an error occured

examples.title: Node.js:
python:
ruby:
examples.content:
require 'json'
require 'net/http'
require 'uri'

uri = URI.parse('http://localhost:3003/timer')
payload = {
 timeout: 3000,
 data: "hello world",
 callback: {
   method: 'post',
   transport: 'http',
   uri: 'http://localhost:4000'
 }
}

http = Net::HTTP.new(uri.host, uri.port)
request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(uri.request_uri, {'Content-Type': 'application/json'})
request.body = payload.to_json
response = http.request(request)
print response.code
